content: What is the formula to calculate the total cost of a product based on its quantity and unit cost? Please provide the formula in [Latex] format.

The formula to calculate the total cost of a product based on its quantity and unit cost can be expressed in LaTeX as follows:

\[ \text{Total Cost} = \text{Quantity} \times \text{Unit Cost} \]

Where:
- \(\text{Total Cost}\) is the overall cost for the given quantity of the product.
- \(\text{Quantity}\) is the number of units of the product.
- \(\text{Unit Cost}\) is the cost per individual unit of the product.
